You’re just a few steps away from applying to be a UST Celt! Join us to push the limits, fearlessly pursue knowledge and find your future. Select which type of student you are from the choices below. Create an account, or sign in to your account to complete your application.
I am a high school student who will enter UST as a freshman.
Cumulative GPA of 2.8 or higher (on a 4.0 scale)
Minimum of 1140 on SAT (UST school code: 6880)
Minimum of 23 on ACT (UST school code: 4238)
I’m in college, I attended UST previously or I’m an adult looking to complete my bachelor’s degree.
*If less than 24 hours, contact counselor for additional requirements
I plan to get a degree in nursing.
Minimum requirements depend on whether you will be a freshman or transfer student.
I’m in high school and would like to take classes to earn college credit.
Junior or senior in high school or home school while taking classes at UST
Minimum GPA of 3.0 on high school coursework, supported by official transcript
Admission criteria based on PSAT, SAT and ACT scores
I have a bachelor’s degree and now want to pursue a second one, or take prerequisite courses for grad school.
I’m a veteran looking to take college classes or complete my degree.
Up to 72 from a community college
*If less than 24 hours, contact Veteran Success Center for additional requirements
I have a bachelor’s degree and will be attending UST as a graduate student.
Official transcripts from all institutions attended
I have a bachelor’s degree in nursing and will be attending UST as a nursing graduate student.
Update your information and keep track of already completed applications.

You have the option to apply without using your SAT or ACT score if you meet these requirements:
Write an essay indicating why test scores are not reflective of your academic ability
Interview in person or over the phone with an admissions counselor
Submit an official high school transcript with a 3.4 GPA or higher on a 4.0 scale

What can we help you find?

An artistic marvel, the Chapel of St. Basil was designed by the late architect Philip Johnson and completed in 1997. In keeping with the University’s Basilian tradition, the chapel is named for St. Basil the Great, a fourth century bishop in what today is the country of Turkey. The chapel sits at the north end of the University’s academic mall, which was also designed by Johnson some 40 years earlier.
The Chapel hosts Mass every day

. It seats about 225 people and is lit from the inside by natural light from the dome, a skylight over the altar and the statue of Our Lady on the east wall and from the asymmetrical glass cross on the west wall.

The external design consists of three basic geometric shapes: a 50 foot white stucco cube for the body of the church, a sphere for the dome and a black granite plane that intersects the dome and the cube.
The Chapel of St. Basil and Doherty Library face each other from opposite ends of the Academic Mall to signify the perpetual relationship between faith and reason.

If you are a baptized Catholic interested in being Confirmed, Campus Ministry offers semester-long Confirmation preparation twice per year. Weekly gatherings of prayer, teaching, and small group conversation will form and prepare you for full and active participation in the life of the Church. Confirmations are celebrated twice per year.
For more information on Confirmation or Reconciliation, contact:
The Chapel of St. Basil is under the jurisdiction of St. Anne’s Catholic Church.
All sacraments celebrated at the Chapel need to be registered through St. Anne’s.
To celebrate the sacrament of Marriage at the Chapel, there are a specific set of requirements that must be met.
View the Winter Break Mass Schedule
​The Rite of Christian Initiation of Adults (or RCIA) is a learning and preparation process for those interested in becoming Catholic.
RCIA sessions will be offered on Wednesday evenings during the 2018-2019 academic year.
Any student and member of the UST community desiring to learn more about the Catholic faith is welcome to attend.
